job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Santa Monica, CA
pros: They have good benefits and great hardworking coworkers always willing to pitch in. The CEO is great and participates and interacts with employees often. The pay is also pretty good.
cons: Internal leadership needs lots of work! Doctors have "tantrums" to get their way and its usually given, even if it's not what's best for the department leaving the staff to pick up the pieces. Unrealistic expectations regarding workload.

review_title: Work load is to much for the low pay

pros: Great staff and management. Never had one issue with staff of any sort. Never felt over-worked or that my assignment was too much.
cons: The pace of the ER is on the slower side. Sometimes difficult to move patients due to the overall pace of things here.

job_title: Under Paid Medical Professional in Thibodaux, LA
pros: Great medical staff and great equipment, good local people.  If you have trauma, this is the trauma center to be transported to.  Most likely to depart alive!
cons: Expansion after expansion all on the employee's backs.  Lots of building and no pay raises due to low or no reimbursements.  If we are not getting reimbursed, why build more offices.  Freeze salries then announce expansion project?????  Say what?

job_title: Patient Care Technician in Thibodaux, LA
cons: Very predujice place to work. Very political. Upper management would hire from the outside a person who has NO experience compared to an individual that has experience  in a hospital setting for 10 + years. Nurses will try to get a'patient care tech to try to teach them something that they have little knowledge about but they are the ones that lack the knowledge and good luck if you are a patient nothing but young nurses that play with people lives and don't have a clue as to what is going on.

pros:
1. If you teach a class there as a fitness instructor you will be paid more than $20 per hr.
2. You get a free membership to the fitness center if you work there for yourself, not your family. You will have to pay for your family's membership.
3. It's a new fitness center so it's fairly clean and pleasant to work there because of the new clean environment, not because of the people you have to work with.
cons:
1. If you teach a fitness class there and have no students show up to class, you do not get paid!
2. If you report something to management, they won't do anything about it and you'll get labeled as a trouble maker or a chronic complainer!
3. You have to work with equipment that is falling apart or not kept to current safety standards. You report it to management and they do nothing about it. You will have to decide yourself to remove faulty equipment away from member's use so they won't hurt themselves.
4. There are 4 fitness studios there. If you teach fitness classes you will have to contend with hearing the class next door's music and instructor over the microphone in your studio. Then if you turn your music up to try to drown out the noise from the next class, your members in your class will complain to management about your music being too loud. You can't win in this situation. They have no sound boards in any of their fitness studios so the sound goes right through the walls. The Yoga studio is directly next to the Cycling studio. Cycling music way too loud and bass booming coming through the walls while you're trying to teach a meditative flowing Yoga class. You'll end up with little to no students then you won't get paid because you have no students show up to your class.
6. Overall the management is very unprofessional and most of them have little experience working in an actual fitness facility. Most of them were nurses or Les Mills instructors before they got into management, or someone's best friend or relative. Yes, there's a lot of that there too. They will hire their best friend or relatives left and right but not someone who is actually qualified for the position.

pros: Great people to work with! Lots of teamwork. Busy most of the time. Good starter hospital job if looking for experience.
cons: Benefits are awful! No 401k offered, and only 15 hours of paid time off a year. Pay not the best either.
